text: A 65.25 g sample of CuSO4•5H2O (M = 249.7) is dissolved in enough water to make 0.800 L of solution. What volume of this solution must be diluted with water to make 1.00 L of 0.100 M CuSO4?

In the titration of a monoprotic acid with a solution of sodium hydroxide of known concentration, what quantities are equal at the equivalence point?

options.A: the concentrations of hydroxide and hydronium ions
options.B: the number of moles of hydroxide ion added and the number of moles of hydronium ion initially present
options.C: the volume of sodium hydroxide solution added and the volume of acid solution initially present
options.D: the number of moles of hydroxide ion added and the number of moles of monoprotic acid initially present

The reaction rate doubles when the concentration of B is doubled and the concentration of A is held constant. What are the orders of A and B in this reaction?
Which statement is true about a reactant that appears in the balanced equation for a reaction but does not appear in the rate equation?

options.B: It is not part of the reaction.
options.C: Its concentration is too low to be important.
options.D: It takes part in the reaction after the rate- determining step.

text: Introduction of two drops of concentrated sulfuric acid, H2SO4, speeds up an esterification reaction. Introduction of a piece of platinum metal, Pt, speeds up the reaction of H2 and O2 gas. Which of the following statements is true?

options.A: Pt is a homogeneous catalyst; H2SO4 is a heterogeneous catalyst.
options.B: Pt is a heterogeneous catalyst; H2SO4 is a homogeneous catalyst.
options.C: Pt and H2SO4 are both heterogeneous catalysts.
options.D: Pt and H2SO4 are both homogeneous catalysts.

text: Which change will decrease the rate of the reaction between I2(s) and H2(g)?

options.A: Increasing the partial pressure of H2(g)
options.B: Adding the I2(s) as one piece rather than as several small ones
options.D: Adding a catalyst for the reaction

text: Which one of the following mixtures creates a buffer solution?

text: Which expression gives the correct value for the standard potential for a gold-rhodium voltaic cell? Half-reaction E˚, V Rh3+ (aq) + 3e– → Rh(s) 0.76 Au+ (aq) + e– → Au(s) 1.69

text: Consider a voltaic cell in which the reaction below occurs in two half-cells connected by a salt bridge and an external circuit. 2Cr(s) + 3Sn2+(aq) → 3Sn(s) + 2Cr3+(aq) E˚ = 0.603 V Which change will cause the voltage to increase?

options.A: Increasing the amount of Sn(s) in its half-cell
options.B: Increasing the amount of Cr(s) in its half-cell
options.C: Diluting the solution in the anode compartment
options.D: Diluting the solution in the cathode compartment
